      • getMode

        public int getMode()
        Implements the PDFViewCtrl.Tool interfaces
        Specified by:
        getMode in interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool

      • onDown

        public boolean onDown(MotionEvent e)
        Description copied from interface: PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Called when PDFViewCtrl.onDown() is triggered.
        Specified by:
        onDown in interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.

      • onUp

        public boolean onUp(MotionEvent e,
           int prior_event_type)
        Description copied from interface: PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Called when PDFViewCtrl.onUp() is triggered.
        Specified by:
        onUp in interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Parameters:
        e - the up motion event.
        prior_event_type - indicates the prior event type. Possible values are:
        • PDFViewCtrl.PRIOR_EVENT_SCROLLING
        • PDFViewCtrl.PRIOR_EVENT_PINCH
        • PDFViewCtrl.PRIOR_EVENT_FLING
        • PDFViewCtrl.PRIOR_EVENT_DBLTAP
        • PDFViewCtrl.PRIOR_EVENT_OTHER
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.

      • getNextToolMode

        public final int getNextToolMode()
        Description copied from interface: PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Returns the mode of the next tool. Via this, a tool can indicate the next tool to switch to.
        Specified by:
        getNextToolMode in interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool

      • onDocumentDownloadEvent

        public void onDocumentDownloadEvent(int type,
                           int page_num,
                           int page_downloaded,
                           int page_count,
                           java.lang.String message)
        Description copied from interface: PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Called when an update from document downloading is available, which can be started by PDFViewCtrl#openURL(String, String).
        Specified by:
        onDocumentDownloadEvent in interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the update. Possible values are:
        • PDFViewCtrl.DOWNLOAD_START
        • PDFViewCtrl.DOWNLOAD_PAGE
        • PDFViewCtrl.DOWNLOAD_FINISH
        • PDFViewCtrl.DOWNLOAD_FAIL
        page_num - the number of the page that is just downloaded. Meaningful if type is PDFViewCtrl.DOWNLOAD_PAGE.
        page_downloaded - the total number of pages that have been downloaded.
        page_count - the page count of the associated document.
        message - error message in case the download has failed.

      • onFlingStop

        public boolean onFlingStop()
        Description copied from interface: PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Called when a fling motion stops by itself (not by a touching event).
        Specified by:
        onFlingStop in interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, false should be returned.

      • onMove

        public boolean onMove(MotionEvent e1,
             MotionEvent e2,
             float x_dist,
             float y_dist)
        Description copied from interface: PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Called when PDFViewCtrl.onScroll() is triggered.
        Specified by:
        onMove in interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Returns:
        true if the event is swallowed by the tool. This way, PDFViewCtrl will not perform its usual task associated with this event. In general, true should be returned so that while the tool is moving, the content will not be scrolled.

      • onLayout

        public void onLayout(boolean changed,
            int l,
            int t,
            int r,
            int b)
        Description copied from interface: PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Called when PDFViewCtrl's onLayout(), e.g., android.view.View.onLayout(), is triggered, or PDFViewCtrl's page presentation mode or page view mode is changed by PDFViewCtrl.setPagePresentationMode(int) or PDFViewCtrl.setPageViewMode(int).
        Specified by:
        onLayout in interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Parameters:
        changed - This is a new size or position for this view.
        l - Left position, relative to parent
        t - Top position, relative to parent
        r - Right position, relative to parent
        b - Bottom position, relative to parent

      • onClose

        public void onClose()
        Description copied from interface: PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Called by PDFViewCtrl to indicate the tool is being closed, e.g., when the current document is being closed. Tool should clean up at this moment, e.g., closing its menu.
        Specified by:
        onClose in interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool

      • onCustom

        public void onCustom(java.lang.Object o)
        Description copied from interface: PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Called by PDFViewCtrl in the next message loop of the main thread. This callback can be registered through PDFViewCtrl.postToolOnCustomEvent(Object) method. Note that this function is called only once per posting.
        Specified by:
        onCustom in interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Parameters:
        o - The Object passed in when calling PDFViewCtrl.postToolOnCustomEvent(Object).

      • onSetDoc

        public void onSetDoc()
        Description copied from interface: PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Called by PDFViewCtrl after {link PDFViewCtrl.setDoc(PDFDoc) is called and the document is set within PDFViewCtrl.
        Specified by:
        onSetDoc in interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate()
        Called after the tool is created by PDFViewCtrlManager.

      • onDraw

        public void onDraw(Canvas canvas,
          android.graphics.Matrix tfm)
        Description copied from interface: PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Called by PDFViewCtrl to draw tool's content, if there is any. Note that this is called after all the document content is drawn; therefore the content drawn in this function will be on top of the document content.
        Specified by:
        onDraw in interface PDFViewCtrl.Tool
        Parameters:
        canvas - The android.graphics.Canvas object to draw on PDFViewCtrl.
        tfm - The extra transformation matrix applied to 'canvas'. This matrix is normally an identity matrix unless when the built-in page sliding is in process. The inverse of this matrix can be temporarily applied to 'canvas' in order to make the content drawn in this function appear stationary during sliding.
